form.page_subtitle: PNC Counselling: Infant Feeding> Exclusive Breastfeeding When Mother is Taking ARVs TWO

field.name: All babies who test positive for HIV at 6 weeks should breastfeed exclusively until 6 months, even without ARV interventions, and then continue breastfeeding for up to 2 years or longer. Complementary foods should be introduced at 6 months

All breastfeeding babies who test negative for HIV at 6 weeks should continue to exclusively breastfeed until 6 months, even without ARV interventions, and continue to breastfeed until 12 months. Complementary foods should be introduced at 6 months. After 12 months, breastfeeding should only stop once a safe and nutritionally adequate diet without can be given to the baby
